subject: Re: [junit] Re: Printing results from JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Oh, that s the *right* way to do it.  :}  I was trying to avoid suggesting code extensions.  Personally, i ve found that Junit from within Ant provides
messageBody:
nils_khare@... wrote:
>
> Extend the TestRunner class and override printFailures(), printErrors
> () etc. methods to your liking. Use this extended class (you may call
> it whatever say 'MyTestRunner' to give it a name) to run your tests
> and then whoa .... you have a complete control on the output.

Oh, that's the *right* way to do it. :} I was trying to avoid
suggesting code extensions. Personally, i've found that Junit from
within Ant provides good reporting, at least good enough that i don't
feel the need to be any fancier.

I just spent the afternoon automating SQL object creation with Ant too,
rather than cleaning up a script. Ant is a Good Thing, right up there
with Junit. You know what the great thing about using Junit, Ant, J2EE,
and a Unix shell environment is? For the first time in my programming
career, i don't feel like i'm fighting with my tools. :}
--

David Stagner
